    • Method Detail

      • doHorizontalReduce

        public NiFormulaicAmountCell doHorizontalReduce(java.util.List<NiCell> cells)
        combines multiple elementary cells into one NiFormulaicAmountCell. It has 3 functions to fulfill:
        • group NiCell by the tag of the enclosed cell and separate them into lists
        • call the respective reductor on each of the lists, thus forming the vars-values
        • evaluate the expression tree on the given vars-values and return a cell with the built value
        Returns:

      • buildVals

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.math.BigDecimal> buildVals(java.util.List<NiCell> cells)

      • sumCells

        protected java.math.BigDecimal sumCells(java.util.List<NiCell> l)

      • extractCellTag

        protected java.lang.String extractCellTag(NiCell cell)

      • doVerticalReduce

        public NiFormulaicAmountCell doVerticalReduce(java.util.Collection<NiFormulaicAmountCell> cells)
        does vertical reduction based on a formula. This is a 3-step process:
        • collect the respective values from cells, grouping them by tag
        • call the respective reductor on each of the lists, thus forming the vars-values
        • evaluate the expression tree on the given vars-values and return a cell with the built value
        You might notice that steps 2-3 are identical to the ones of doHorizontalReduce(List)

      • getZeroCell

        public NiFormulaicAmountCell getZeroCell()
        Description copied from interface: Behaviour
        computes a "zero" cell, which is different from an "empty" cell. For numerical cells, this is a cell with zero. For textual cells, this is an "" cell
        Returns:

      • buildNoValueCell

        public NiFormulaicAmountCell buildNoValueCell(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.math.BigDecimal> vals)
